## Family Resolutions for the New Year (A Husband’s Commitment)

As the head of the family, God has entrusted the husband with the responsibility of **spiritual leadership, love, and example**. These family resolutions are not about perfection, but about **growing together in faith, unity, and obedience to God**.

> **“As for me and my house, we will serve the LORD.”**  
> — *Joshua 24:15*

---

### 1. A Resolution to Grow Closer to God as a Family
We resolve to make God the center of our home, decisions, and daily life. Our desire is not merely to know about God, but to **walk with Him together** as a family.

> **“Draw near to God and He will draw near to you.”**  
> — *James 4:8*

**Practical commitment:**
- Begin and end our days acknowledging God  
- Invite God into family conversations and decisions  

---

### 2. A Resolution to Pray Together Daily (8:00 PM – 9:00 PM)
We resolve to set aside **intentional family prayer time every evening**, trusting God to unite our hearts through prayer.

> **“Where two or three are gathered together in My name, I am there in the midst of them.”**  
> — *Matthew 18:20*

**Practical commitment:**
- Family prayer time from **8:00 PM to 9:00 PM**  
- Sharing prayer requests and thanksgiving  
- Praying for spiritual growth, health, provision, and peace  

---

### 3. A Resolution to Study the Bible Together Twice a Week
We resolve to study God’s Word together **at least twice a week**, allowing Scripture to shape our values, conversations, and lifestyle.

> **“Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly.”**  
> — *Colossians 3:16*

**Practical commitment:**
- Bible study **two days per week**  
- At least **30 minutes per session**  
- Simple discussion: *What does this teach us? How do we apply it?*

> **“Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.”**  
> — *Psalm 119:105*

---

### 4. A Resolution to Walk in Love, Unity, and Forgiveness at Home
We resolve to cultivate a home marked by **love, patience, humility, and forgiveness**, choosing peace over conflict.

> **“Above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfection.”**  
> — *Colossians 3:14*

**Practical commitment:**
- Address conflicts with prayer and humility  
- Practice forgiveness quickly  
- Speak words that build and encourage  

---

### 5. A Resolution to Lead by Example as a Husband and Father
As the husband, I resolve to **lead by example**, modeling prayer, humility, discipline, and love, trusting God to work through my obedience.

> **“Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church.”**  
> — *Ephesians 5:25*

> **“Train up a child in the way he should go.”**  
> — *Proverbs 22:6*

**Practical commitment:**
- Be consistent in personal devotion  
- Lead family worship faithfully  
- Serve my family with love and patience  

---

### A Family Prayer for the New Year
> *“Lord, we commit our home to You. Teach us to love You, to walk in Your ways, and to grow together in faith. May our home be a dwelling place for Your presence. In Jesus’ name, Amen.”*

> **“Unless the LORD builds the house, they labor in vain who build it.”**  
> — *Psalm 127:1*
